thread.title: Ground News - Flood watch for Southeast Pa. for Saturday and Sunday
thread.title_full: Ground News - Flood watch for Southeast Pa. for Saturday and Sunday

author: Ground News
title: Ground News - Flood watch for Southeast Pa. for Saturday and Sunday
text:
Summary by Ground News A flood watch was issued by the National Weather Service on Friday at 3:25 a.m. for Berks, Lehigh and Northampton counties. In flood-prone areas, it's crucial to move immediately to higher ground. A flash flood is a sudden and violent inundation that can develop within minutes to hours. Share menu 0 Articles 0 Articles All Left Center Right
Penn Live Center High Factuality Media Conglomerate: Advance Publications Flood watch for Southeast Pa. for Saturday and Sunday A flood watch was issued by the National Weather Service on Friday at 3:25 a.m. valid from Saturday 4 a.m. until Sunday 8 a.m. for Berks, Lehigh and Northampton counties.The weather service describes, "Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible."
